adrFormatAddress: 455 West 64th Street, Building, 100 Riverside Blvd, New York, NY 10069, USA

originalText.text:
Have been training with Abena every week without fail for a few years now, I cannot recommend it enough, especially if like me your posture is taking a toll from working at a computer all day.

From strengthening to stretching, Abena keeps it playful, in a relaxed but focused private space.

I train with Fina and Camilo when Abena is on (well deserved) vacation—all instructors at the studio are fantastic, with their own style.

originalText.text: Very positive atmosphere and well trained and professional instructors.So pleased to work with Fina. We have been together for about a year and a half and she always has a thoughtful and planned approach for our session Including challenges along our path. She is very precise and encouraging in her instruction. I feel that I have benefited a great deal under her guidance.

text.text: Very positive atmosphere and well trained and professional instructors.So pleased to work with Fina. We have been together for about a year and a half and she always has a thoughtful and planned approach for our session Including challenges along our path. She is very precise and encouraging in her instruction. I feel that I have benefited a great deal under her guidance.

originalText.text: I had my first class with Bora today - she is very nice, patient and kind. She demonstrated understanding and care when I explained to her about my neck and shoulder pain issues. During the session, she helped me building my powerhouse and enabled me to comprehend the mechanisms behind different movements, which I now understand is the key for having the right posture. Bora said that she would teach me some mat postures in next class, so I could practice at home as well. The studio in general has a very warm and welcoming atmosphere. Recommend this place!

originalText.text:
If you're scrolling through a sea of Pilates instructors and wondering who to choose, let me save you some time: pick Abena. Here's why:

As a guy who stumbled into Pilates a few years ago, thinking it was just a series of stretches, I have learned that Pilates is a transformation. "The more you put in, the more you get back” kind of thing. You will learn patience, commitment, and willingness to push a little harder each time. If this sounds New Age-y, let me tell you I’m anything but, quite the opposite.

Pilates with Abena is more a marathon than a sprint. The long-term rewards are monumental. You may not notice them in a day or a week, but over a few months, you'll be a different person. Even, or especially, on days when I’m tired and barely find the motivation to go, I always end up refreshed and energized.

About Abena herself. She's not just an instructor who follows a bunch of pre-defined routines. She knows how to read the room — or, in this case, the person — and has an uncanny ability to adapt your training to exactly where you are at that moment, always nudging you to the edge of your limit but never over. This perfect blend of challenge and understanding makes every session with her a unique experience.

So, if you're ready to embark on a Pilates journey that will challenge, change, and ultimately reward you, Abena's your go-to. Trust me, your future self will thank you!
